---
title: "TidyTuesday-2025-Jan-wk2"
author: "Arham Chouhury"
format: html
---

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidytuesdayR)
library(readxl)
library(writexl)
library(ellmer)
library(glue)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2025-01-14')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
---- Compiling #TidyTuesday Information for 2025-01-14 ----
--- There are 2 files available ---


── Downloading files ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

  1 of 2: "conf2023.csv"
  2 of 2: "conf2024.csv"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
conf2023 <- tuesdata$conf2023
conf2024 <- tuesdata$conf2024

df <- conf2024 |> 
  filter(track == "Lightning Talks") |> 
  filter(is.na(description) == FALSE) |> 
  select(talk_title, description) |> 
  rename_with(~ paste0("human_", .))
df
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 8 × 2
  human_talk_title                                             human_description
  <chr>                                                        <chr>            
1 rainbowR - a community that supports, connects and promotes… "rainbowR's miss…
2 JSquarto: Bridging JavaScript Documentation with Quarto's P… "In this talk, R…
3 Ten Simple Rules for Teaching an Introduction to R           "Many of us feel…
4 R Scripts to Databricks: Lessons in Production Workflow      "This talk is ab…
5 Translating clinical guidance to actionable insights with R  "COTA’s team of …
6 Why’d you load that package for?                             "Packages enhanc…
7 DataPages for interactive data sharing using Quarto          "Findable, acces…
8 Using the Kyber R package to connect Google Sheets, RMarkdo… "As we work in o…
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Function to count the number of words in a string
count_words <- function(text) {
  ifelse(is.na(text), 0, str_count(text, "\\S+"))
}

df <- df |>
  mutate(human_title_word_count = count_words(human_talk_title)) |> 
  mutate(human_description_word_count = count_words(human_description))
df
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 8 × 4
```

:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#functions to use in {ellmer} #1
basic_summary <- function(text) {
  chat <- chat_openai(
    model = "gpt-4o",
    system_prompt = "You are a friendly assistant.",
  )
  chat$chat(glue("Summarize this text in under 15 words: {text}"))
}
basic_summary
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
function (text) 
{
    chat <- chat_openai(model = "gpt-4o", system_prompt = "You are a friendly assistant.", 
        )
    chat$chat(glue("Summarize this text in under 15 words: {text}"))
}
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#functions to use in {ellmer} #2
generate_talk_title <- function(text) {
  chat <- chat_openai(
    model = "gpt-4o",
    system_prompt = "You are a great public speaker",
  )
  chat$chat(glue("Using less than 15 words, 
                 create a compelling headline 
                 from the abstract of this talk: {text}"))
}
generate_talk_title
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
function (text) 
{
    chat <- chat_openai(model = "gpt-4o", system_prompt = "You are a great public speaker", 
        )
    chat$chat(glue("Using less than 15 words, \n                 create a compelling headline \n                 from the abstract of this talk: {text}"))
}
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
df_ai_summaries <- df |> 
  group_by(human_talk_title) |> 
  mutate(ai_summary = basic_summary(human_description)) |> 
  mutate(ai_summary_word_count = count_words(ai_summary))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Datapages improve FAIR data sharing by providing easy tools for interactive and
accessible datasets.
Richie Moluno introduces JSquarto for generating multilingual, flexible 
JavaScript documentation integrated with GitHub.
Disney automated and scaled ESPN's marketing measurement using R, Python, SQL, 
Databricks, and Tableau.
Find top 10 quick tips for effectively teaching R, including setup, 
practicality, and learner understanding.
COTA developed "rwnavigator" R package to help users analyze oncology data, 
overcoming development challenges.
Kyber automates data science setup tasks, enhancing teaching efficiency and 
collaborative opportunities.
Discusses improving package management with annotations and code comments for 
clarity in projects.
rainbowR connects and supports LGBTQ+ in the R community through data-driven 
activism and involvement.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
df_ai_summaries
```

:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
df_ai_titles <- df |> 
  group_by(human_talk_title) |> 
  mutate(ai_summary = generate_talk_title(human_description)) |> 
  mutate(ai_summary_word_count = count_words(ai_summary))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
"Empower Research with Datapages: Simplify FAIR Data Sharing and Interactive 
Visualization"
"Revolutionize JavaScript Documentation: Meet JSquarto for Multilingual, 
Flexible Design & Automated Updates."
"Scaling Disney's ESPN Marketing: Automation Insights with R, Python, SQL, and 
More"
"Master Teaching R: Top 10 Tips for Success and Engaged Learning"
"Revolutionize Data Analysis: Introducing Rwnavigator for Life Sciences and 
Oncology Experts"
"Automate Open Data Science Setup: Kyber Streamlines Workshops, Boosting 
Collaboration and Efficiency"
"Streamline Code: Enhance Insights from Package Annotations and GitHub 
Comments"
"Empower LGBTQ+ Voices in R: Join the rainbowR Community and Drive Data-Driven 
Change!"
```
